edu.wpi.cetask

Class Shell

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.cetask.Shell
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Console, Guide

    public class Shell
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple command shell for interacting with the task engine.
    See Also:
    Guide, SpeechGuide

        public void setOut(java.io.PrintStream stream)

      • cd

        public void cd(java.lang.String dir)
        Change current working directory. Accepts relative or absolute directory string. Note for Windows, does not accept the the drive prefix, thus \Users\rich, not C:\Users\rich

      • status

        public void status(java.lang.String ignore)
        Print out current task decomposition tree with status information.

      • verbose

        public void verbose(java.lang.String state)
        Control verbose output.
        Parameters:
        state - - "true" or "false" (empty means true)

      • debug

        public void debug(java.lang.String state)
        Control debugging output. Note initial setting is determined by "engine@debug" property.
        Parameters:
        state - - "true" or "false"

      • processTaskIf

                 Plan focus,
                 boolean success)
        See Also:
        processTask(String,Plan,boolean)

      • processTask

        public Task processTask(java.lang.String args,
               Plan focus,
               boolean optional)
        Return the task instance represented by given shell arguments. JavaScript to compute all declared input and output slot values is required (in order declared). Success slot value is followed by external are optional (and last). Skipped slots can be specified by '/ /'.

        Hint: If Javascript contains '/', use 'eval' command to set temporary variable and use variable in 'done'.
        Parameters:
        args - [<id> [<namespace>]] [ / <value> ]*
